definitions.definition: Flattering speech or actions designed to persuade or influence.
A sound that results from the passage of air through restrictions of the oral cavity; any sound that is not the dominant sound of a syllable, the dominant sound generally being a vowel.
A letter representing the sound of a consonant.
definitions.example: The 19 unquestionable consonants in the English alphabet are B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, N, P, Q, R, S, T, V, X, Z.

definitions.definition: Characterized by harmony or agreement.
Having the same sound.
Harmonizing together; accordant.
definitions.example: consonant tones; consonant chords

definitions.definition: Of or relating to consonants; made up of, or containing many, consonants.
An important main road used by long-distance traffic, as well as heavy lorries.
A blue-green colour, mostly green.
Of a blue-green colour, mostly green.
A voice or voice part intermediate in compass between soprano and contralto.
A person having such a voice.
A government-funded agency that helps the unemployed to find work.
A castrated man; a eunuch.
To remove the testicles of an animal.
To remove the ovaries and/or uterus of an animal.
To take something from; to render imperfect or ineffectual.
Excessive love of oneself.
Sexual desire for one's own body.
Inspiring or deserving love or affection.
The state of being extremely friendly; intimacy.
Undue intimacy; inappropriate informality, impertinence.
An instance of familiar behaviour.
Close or habitual acquaintance with someone or something; understanding or recognition acquired from experience.
Covered with, or containing unclean matter; dirty.
definitions.example: A ship's bottom is foul when overgrown with barnacles

definitions.definition: (of words or a way of speaking) obscene, vulgar or abusive.
definitions.example: His foul language causes many people to believe he is uneducated.

definitions.definition: Detestable, unpleasant, loathsome.
definitions.example: He has a foul set of friends.

definitions.definition: Disgusting, repulsive; causing disgust.
definitions.example: There was a foul smell coming from the toilet.

definitions.definition: Ugly; homely; poor.
(of the weather) Unpleasant, stormy or rainy.
definitions.example: Some foul weather is brewing.

definitions.definition: Dishonest or not conforming to the established rules and customs of a game, conflict, test, etc.
definitions.example: Foul play is not suspected.

definitions.definition: Entangled and therefore restricting free movement, not clear.
definitions.example: We've got a foul anchor.

definitions.definition: Outside of the base lines; in foul territory.
definitions.example: Jones hit foul ball after foul ball.

definitions.definition: A breach of the rules of a game, especially one involving inappropriate contact with an opposing player in order to gain an advantage; for example, tripping someone up in soccer, or contact of any kind in basketball.
A (usually accidental) contact between a bowler and the lane before the bowler has released the ball.
A foul ball, a ball which has been hit outside of the base lines.
definitions.example: Jones hit a foul up over the screen.

definitions.definition: To make dirty.
definitions.example: She's fouled her diaper.

definitions.definition: To besmirch.
definitions.example: He's fouled his reputation.

definitions.definition: To clog or obstruct.
definitions.example: The hair has fouled the drain.

definitions.definition: To entangle.
definitions.example: The kelp has fouled the prop.

definitions.definition: To make contact with an opposing player in order to gain advantage.
definitions.example: Smith fouled him hard.

definitions.definition: To hit outside of the baselines.
definitions.example: Jones fouled the ball off the facing of the upper deck.

definitions.definition: To become clogged.
definitions.example: The drain fouled.

definitions.definition: To become entangled.
definitions.example: The prop fouled on the kelp.

definitions.definition: To commit a foul.
definitions.example: Smith fouled within the first minute of the quarter.

definitions.definition: To hit a ball outside of the baselines.
definitions.example: Jones fouled for strike one.

definitions.definition: A cycle with three wheels, powered by pedals and usually intended for young children.
A cycle rickshaw.
To ride a tricycle.
definitions.example: The child tricycled around the driveway until dark.

definitions.definition: To board or mount (something), especially a vehicle.
definitions.example: Please get on the bus as quickly as possible.

definitions.definition: To be successful.
definitions.example: I hear John has a new job. How's he getting on?

definitions.definition: (with "with") To progress (with).
definitions.example: It's time to get on with improving quality.

definitions.definition: To become late.
definitions.example: It was getting on for midnight before I went to bed.

definitions.definition: To become old.
definitions.example: My parents are visibly getting on a bit these days.

definitions.definition: To have a good relationship; to get along.
definitions.example: I wish you and I could learn to get on.

definitions.definition: To commence (an action).
definitions.example: The dishes need washing, the floor needs vacuuming, the laundry needs folding. Get on it!

definitions.definition: Expresses surprise or disbelief.
Having a slippery surface; having a surface covered with grease.
definitions.example: a greasy mineral

definitions.definition: Containing a lot of grease or fat.
Shady, sketchy, dodgy, detestable, unethical.
Fat, bulky
Gross; indelicate; indecent
(of a horse) Afflicted with the disease called grease.
Capable of being changed.
Subject to sudden or frequent changes.
definitions.example: The weather is very changeable today: we've had bright sunshine, clouds, wind and rain in the same half-hour.

definitions.definition: (of a species) Capable of camouflaging itself by changing colour.
A roughly-built hut or cabin.
A rudimentary or improvised dwelling, especially one not legally owned.
An unlicensed pub.
A song a sailor sings, especially in rhythm to his work.
To make tough.
To become tough.
(idiomat) to be vigilant and aware
definitions.example: While you're in the city center, look out for the dodgy street vendors.

definitions.definition: To find by looking: to hunt out
Any object that resembles one half of a pair of pincers.
(sometimes figurative) To surround with a pincer attack.
An arboreal anthropoid ape genus Pongo consisting of two species, Pongo pygmaeus of Borneo and Pongo abelii of Sumatra, having a shaggy reddish-brown coat, long arms, and no tail.
A transparent purple variety of quartz, used as a gemstone.
A purple colour.
The purple tincture when emblazoning the arms of the English nobility.
Having a colour similar to that of the gemstone
A hamburger containing cheese (usually one or more slices of processed cheese).

Any of several Hindu or Buddhist disciplines aimed at training the consciousness for a state of perfect spiritual insight and tranquillity; especially a system of exercises practiced to promote control of the body and mind.
The tree Elaeocarpus joga.
The process of making an estimate.
The amount, extent, position, size, or value reached in an estimate.
Esteem or favourable regard.
A four-wheeled vehicle with a drivetrain that allows all four wheels to receive torque from the engine simultaneously.
(uncountable) the type of vehicle transmission system.
To commit a double fault.
Someone freed from slavery in Ancient Rome; a freedman.
One who is freethinking in religious matters.
Someone (especially a man) who takes no notice of moral laws, especially those involving sexual propriety; someone loose in morals; a pleasure-seeker.
Dissolute, licentious, profligate; loose in morals.
A traditional sailing vessel used along the coasts of Arabia, East Africa, and the Indian Ocean, generally having a single mast and a lateen sail.
The quality of being reflective.
In an indirect manner.
A sail or either of the two sails rigged just above the course sail and supported by the topmast on a square-rigged sailing ship.
In a fore-and-aft-rigged sailing boat, the sail that is set above the gaff at the top part of the mast.
To form buds.
definitions.example: The trees are finally starting to bud.

definitions.definition: To reproduce by splitting off buds.
definitions.example: Yeast reproduces by budding.

definitions.definition: To begin to grow, or to issue from a stock in the manner of a bud, as a horn.
To be like a bud in respect to youth and freshness, or growth and promise.
To put forth as a bud.
To graft by inserting a bud under the bark of another tree.
The practice of uniting a single scion bud with rootstock or bark; the result of this practice.
Beginning to develop.
A person who believes in an apocalyptic millennium.
Pertaining to the belief in an impending period of one thousand years of peace and righteousness associated with the Second Coming of Christ.
Pertaining to any of various religious or social movements which believe in a coming radical change to existing world order.
Lasting or expected to last a thousand years.
A failure; a mistake or error.
The spontaneous natural termination of a pregnancy, especially before it is viable; the fatal expulsion of a foetus from the womb before term.
A former unit of currency of France, Belgium and Luxembourg, replaced by the euro.
Any of several units of currency, some of which are multi-national (West African CFA Franc (XOF), Central African CFA Franc (XAF), the Swiss franc (CHF)) while others are national currencies.
In ice hockey and lacrosse, a player position with a primary responsibility to prevent the opposing team from scoring goals; same as defender in many other ballgames.
A line formed by the surface of the water on the hull of a ship when she is afloat; any of a series of short lines marked on the hull to show where the waterline would be under different loadings.
A horizontal line indicating the shape of an airfoil.
A line showing where the water has been, usually a line separating dry land and wet areas; a watermark or tidemark.
The inner rim of the eyelid, just behind the lash line; primarily used in reference to the application of eyeliner.
A monarch; the ruler of a country.
One who is not a subject to a ruler or nation.
A gold coin of the United Kingdom, with a nominal value of one pound sterling but in practice used as a bullion coin.
A very large champagne bottle with the capacity of about 25 liters, equivalent to 33⅓ standard bottles.
Any butterfly of the tribe Nymphalini, or genus Basilarchia, as the ursula and the viceroy.
A large, garish ring; a sovereign ring.
To rule over as a sovereign.
Exercising power of rule.
definitions.example: sovereign nation

definitions.definition: Exceptional in quality.
definitions.example: Her voice was her sovereign talent.

definitions.definition: Extremely potent or effective (of a medicine, remedy etc.).
Having supreme, ultimate power.
Princely; royal.
Predominant; greatest; utmost; paramount.
To assign a gender to (a person); to perceive as having a gender; to address using terms (pronouns, nouns, adjectives...) that express a certain gender.
To perceive (a thing) as having characteristics associated with a certain gender, or as having been authored by someone of a certain gender.
To engender.
To breed.
(of a language) Having grammatical gender.
definitions.example: Grammatically, Hebrew is a gendered language because every noun is either masculine or feminine.

definitions.definition: Pertaining to gender or having attributes due to gender.
definitions.example: His clothes were highly gendered.

definitions.definition: Divided by gender.
definitions.example: In the past, parenting was a more gendered activity with more distinct male and female roles.

definitions.definition: Any of four species of wading birds in the genus Recurvirostra, of the family Recurvirostridae, with long, slender recurved bills, long legs, and webbed feet.
Inflammation of the mucous membranes of the nose and throat.
A discharge of fluid associated with this condition.
The building where firefighters and fire trucks/fire engines are housed when not answering an alarm.
The prerogative to praise oneself for a skill or accomplishment.
Honor, prestige
An insect in the order Orthoptera, especially family Gryllidae, that makes a chirping sound by rubbing its wing casings against combs on its hind legs.
A wooden footstool.
A signalling device used by soldiers in hostile territory to identify themselves to a friendly in low visibility conditions.
A relatively small area of a roof constructed to divert water from a horizontal intersection of the roof with a chimney, wall, expansion joint or other projection.
A game played outdoors with bats and a ball between two teams of eleven, popular in England and many Commonwealth countries.
(usually in negative constructions) An act that is fair and sportsmanlike, derived from the sport.
definitions.example: That player's foul wasn't cricket!

definitions.definition: To play the game of cricket.
A disaccharide, C12H22O11 formed from the digestion of starch by amylase; is converted to glucose by maltase; it is an isomer of trehalose
A ball etc. that has been dropped by accident.
To handle nervously or awkwardly.
definitions.example: He fumbled the key into the lock.

definitions.definition: To grope awkwardly in trying to find something
definitions.example: He fumbled for his keys.

definitions.definition: To blunder uncertainly.
definitions.example: He fumbled through his prepared speech.

definitions.definition: To grope about in perplexity; to seek awkwardly.
definitions.example: to fumble for an excuse

definitions.definition: To drop a ball or a baton etc. by accident.
To handle much; to play childishly; to turn over and over.
A dessert similar to a cross between a fool and a crumble.
The study of the past by excavation and analysis of its material remains:
The Eurasian bullfinch (Pyrrhula pyrrhula).
Any of various other Old World finches in the genus Pyrrhula.
A large, thick quickset hedge.

A service provided by a news agency that transmits news reports to subscribers electronically, e.g. by telegraph or the Internet. The subscribers are usually media outlets such as newspapers. Examples include the Associated Press and United Press International.
A form of exercise in which weights are lifted.
A sport in which competitors lift heavy weights in two events: the snatch and the clean and jerk.
(often pejorative) Of, relating to, catering to/for, or visited by tourists.
To question or quiz, especially in a thorough and/or aggressive manner
definitions.example: The police interrogated the suspect at some length before they let him go.

definitions.definition: To query; to request information from.
definitions.example: to interrogate a database

definitions.definition: To examine critically.
A greyish blue colour, tinted with green.
Of a greyish blue colour, tinted with green.
A mechanical or electronic device that performs mathematical calculations.
A person who performs mathematical calculation
A person who calculates (in the sense of scheming).
A set of mathematical tables.
A small fleet of warships (usually of the same class), or a fleet of small ships.
In a disappointing manner.
definitions.example: I spent countless hours revising, but, disappointingly, I still failed the exam.

definitions.definition: A type of concert hammered dulcimer used primarily in the music of Eastern Europe.
The situation in which one event sets off a chain of additional events.
The theory that, if South Vietnam fell to Communism, it would be followed by Cambodia, Laos, additional Southeast Asian countries, other Asian countries, and likely even elsewhere.
A person who is not to be admitted (to a country, a group, etc).
Not admissible, especially that cannot be admitted as evidence at a trial
One who lurks or lies in wait; one who watches in order to rob or betray; a poacher.
A type of crossbreed dog ― a cross between a sighthound and any other breed or the offspring of such crosses.
A large nymphalid butterfly, Yoma sabina, of Australia and Asia.
A glutton; a gormandizer.
Of or relating to genealogy.
Of the relationships among individuals within a species.
Genetic (based on shared membership in a linguistic family).
Noon; twelve o'clock during the day
A chair mounted on large wheels for the transportation or use of a sick or disabled person.
Designed for use by wheelchairbound people.
(by extension) Any device involving wheels designed to assist a non-human animal with locomotion.
A building at the edge of a river, lake or other body of water in which boats are kept.
A scaleless, predatory fish of the superorder Selachimorpha, with a cartilaginous skeleton and 5 to 7 gill slits on each side of its head.
To fish for sharks.
Someone who exploits others, for example by trickery, lies, usury, extortion.
A sleazy and amoral lawyer
An ambulance chaser.
A relentless and resolute person or group, especially in business.
A very good poker or pool player. Compare fish (a bad poker player).
A person who feigns ineptitude to win money from others.
To steal or obtain through fraud.
To play the petty thief; to practice fraud or trickery; to swindle.
To live by shifts and stratagems.
To pick or gather indiscriminately or covertly.
Something or someone that is physically attractive.
definitions.example: That new car of yours is a real beaut.

definitions.definition: Something that is a remarkable example of its type.
Beautiful, splendid.
The set of precision kettledrums in an orchestra.
To cover or furnish with a floor.
definitions.example: floor a house with pine boards

definitions.definition: To strike down or lay level with the floor; to knock down.
(driving) To accelerate rapidly.
definitions.example: As soon as our driver saw an insurgent in a car holding a detonation device, he floored the pedal and was 2,000 feet away when that car bomb exploded. We escaped certain death in the nick of time!

definitions.definition: To silence by a conclusive answer or retort.
definitions.example: Floored or crushed by him. — Coleridge

definitions.definition: To amaze or greatly surprise.
definitions.example: We were floored by his confession.

definitions.definition: To finish or make an end of.
definitions.example: I've floored my little-go work — ed Hughes

definitions.definition: To set a lower bound.
A floor.
A material used to make floors.
The act of putting one's opponent on the floor; a knockdown.

Visible electromagnetic radiation. The human eye can typically detect radiation (light) in the wavelength range of about 400 to 750 nanometers. Nearby shorter and longer wavelength ranges, although not visible, are commonly called ultraviolet and infrared light.
definitions.example: As you can see, this spacious dining-room gets a lot of light in the mornings.

definitions.definition: A source of illumination.
definitions.example: Put that light out!

definitions.definition: Spiritual or mental illumination; enlightenment, useful information.
definitions.example: Can you throw any light on this problem?

definitions.definition: (in the plural) Facts; pieces of information; ideas, concepts.
A notable person within a specific field or discipline.
definitions.example: Picasso was one of the leading lights of the cubist movement.

definitions.definition: The manner in which the light strikes a picture; that part of a picture which represents those objects upon which the light is supposed to fall; the more illuminated part of a landscape or other scene; opposed to shade.
A point of view, or aspect from which a concept, person or thing is regarded.
definitions.example: I'm really seeing you in a different light today.

definitions.definition: A flame or something used to create fire.
definitions.example: Hey, buddy, you got a light?

definitions.definition: A firework made by filling a case with a substance which burns brilliantly with a white or coloured flame.
definitions.example: a Bengal light

definitions.definition: A window, or space for a window in architecture.
definitions.example: This facade has eight south-facing lights.

definitions.definition: The series of squares reserved for the answer to a crossword clue.
definitions.example: The average length of a light on a 15×15 grid is 7 or 8.

definitions.definition: A cross-light in a double acrostic or triple acrostic.
Open view; a visible state or condition; public observation; publicity.
The power of perception by vision.
The brightness of the eye or eyes.
A traffic light, or, by extension, an intersection controlled by one or more that will face a traveler who is receiving instructions.
definitions.example: To get to our house, turn right at the third light.

definitions.definition: Having light; bright; clear; not dark or obscure.
definitions.example: The room is light when the Sun shines through the window.

definitions.definition: Pale or whitish in color; highly luminous and more or less deficient in chroma.
definitions.example: She had light skin.

definitions.definition: (of coffee) Served with extra milk or cream.
definitions.example: I like my coffee light.

definitions.definition: A stone that is not thrown hard enough.
See lights.
Having little or relatively little actual weight; not cumbrous or unwieldy.
definitions.example: a light load ; a lighter backpack after having removed the books ; light weapons

definitions.definition: Having little weight as compared with bulk; of little density or specific gravity.
definitions.example: feathers and cork are light ; oil is lighter than water

definitions.definition: Of short or insufficient weight; weighing less than the legal, standard or proper amount; clipped or diminished.
definitions.example: to issue light coin

definitions.definition: Lacking that which burdens or makes heavy.
Not heavy or soggy; spongy; well raised.
definitions.example: a light bread ; sponge cake is a light cake

definitions.definition: Gentle; having little force or momentum.
definitions.example: This artist clearly had a light, flowing touch.

definitions.definition: Easy to endure or perform.
definitions.example: light duties around the house

definitions.definition: Low in fat, calories, alcohol, salt, etc.
definitions.example: This light beer still gets you drunk if you have enough of it.

definitions.definition: Unimportant, trivial, having little value or significance.
definitions.example: I made some light comment, and we moved on.

definitions.definition: Unchaste, wanton.
Not encumbered; unembarrassed; clear of impediments; hence, active; nimble; swift.
Easily influenced by trifling considerations; unsteady; unsettled; volatile.
definitions.example: a light, vain person; a light mind

definitions.definition: Indulging in, or inclined to, levity; lacking dignity or solemnity; frivolous; airy.
definitions.example: Ogden Nash was a writer of light verse.

definitions.definition: Not quite sound or normal; somewhat impaired or deranged; dizzy; giddy.
Easily interrupted by stimulation.
definitions.example: light sleep; light anesthesia

definitions.definition: Light in composition, notably low in fat, calories etc. Most commonly used commercially.
definitions.example: His lite dinner consisted of crackers, some broccoli and a salad with lite ranch dressing.

definitions.definition: Lightweight
(usually used postpositively) Lacking substance or seriousness; watered down.
A little, bit.
Few; little
The act of waiting; a wait.
To expect; wait.
To rely.
A U-shaped piece of wood used as a collar for an ox, the upper parts fastened to its yoke
A meander in a river; the land enclosed by such a loop
A region of high-energy charged particles which partly surrounds a planet or star, trapped by its magnetic field and characterized by intense radiation.
Armor for the arm; vambrace.
A measurement of length, originally representing a person's outstretched arms.
A curved instrument or handle of iron or wood, for holding and turning bits, etc.; a bitstock.
That which holds anything tightly or supports it firmly; a bandage or a prop.
A cord, ligament, or rod, for producing or maintaining tension.
A thong used to regulate the tension of a drum.
The state of being braced or tight; tension.
Harness; warlike preparation.
A curved, pointed line, also known as "curly bracket": { or } connecting two or more words or lines, which are to be considered together, such as in {role, roll}; in music, used to connect staves.

A pair, a couple; originally used of dogs, and later of animals generally (e.g., a brace of conies) and then other things, but rarely human persons. (The plural in this sense is unchanged.) In British use (as plural), this is a particularly common reference to game birds.

A piece of material used to transmit, or change the direction of, weight or pressure; any one of the pieces, in a frame or truss, which divide the structure into triangular parts. It may act as a tie, or as a strut, and serves to prevent distortion of the structure, and transverse strains in its members. A boiler brace is a diagonal stay, connecting the head with the shell.
A rope reeved through a block at the end of a yard, by which the yard is moved horizontally; also, a rudder gudgeon.
The mouth of a shaft.
(chiefly in the plural) Straps or bands to sustain trousers; suspenders.
(plural in North America, singular or plural in the UK) A system of wires, brackets, and elastic bands used to correct crooked teeth or to reduce overbite.
Two goals scored by one player in a game.
To prepare for something bad, such as an impact or blow.
definitions.example: All hands, brace for impact!

definitions.definition: To place in a position for resisting pressure; to hold firmly.
definitions.example: He braced himself against the crowd.

definitions.definition: To swing round the yards of a square rigged ship, using braces, to present a more efficient sail surface to the direction of the wind.
definitions.example: to brace the yards

definitions.definition: To stop someone for questioning, usually said of police.
To confront with questions, demands or requests.
To furnish with braces; to support; to prop.
definitions.example: to brace a beam in a building

definitions.definition: To draw tight; to tighten; to put in a state of tension; to strain; to strengthen.
definitions.example: to brace the nerves

definitions.definition: To bind or tie closely; to fasten tightly.
The highest ranking editor on an editorial staff.

The branch of medicine that deals with the disorders of nervous system including the brain and spinal cord of the central nervous system and the nerves, muscles, and neuromuscular junction of the peripheral nervous system.
Focal neurologic signs; focal neurologic deficits.
definitions.example: Patient had no neurology.

definitions.definition: Neurological examination.
definitions.example: Neurology is normal.

definitions.definition: A person who breaks in to premises with the intent of committing theft
definitions.example: The burglar made off with a large diamond from the museum.

definitions.definition: To commit burglary; to burgle.
The central narrow bone in the front of the chest, connecting the collarbone and the top ribs.
A large stringed instrument of the violin family, but smaller than the double bass.
The crease or depression of the human body at the junction of the trunk and the thigh, together with the surrounding region.
The area adjoining this fold or depression.
definitions.example: He pulled a muscle in his groin.

definitions.definition: The projecting solid angle formed by the meeting of two vaults
The genitals.
definitions.example: He got kicked in the groin and was writhing in pain.

definitions.definition: The surface formed by two such vaults.
To deliver a blow to the genitals of.
definitions.example: In the scrum he somehow got groined.

definitions.definition: To build with groins.
(literary) To hollow out, to excavate.
definitions.example: 'Down some profound dull tunnel, long since scooped / Through granites which titanic wars had groined.' (From Strange Meeting by Wilfred Owen).

definitions.definition: To grunt; to growl; to snarl; to murmur.
An often wooden structure that projects from a coastline to prevent erosion, longshore drift etc.; a breakwater.
Of, pertaining to, or involving a contribution
Tending to contribute to a result
In a cumulative manner.
A small sum of money given to a child, by a parent or guardian.
A small sum of cash, carried on the person, for small, daily expenses.
Tumultuous, noisy excitement.
Loud confused noise, especially when coming from several sources.
A loud protest, controversy, outrage
To throw into uproar or confusion.
To make an uproar.
A period of something, usually painful or unpleasant.
definitions.example: a bout of drought.

definitions.definition: A boxing match.
An assault (a fencing encounter) at which the score is kept.
A roller derby match.
A fighting competition.
A bulge or widening in a musical instrument, such as either of the two characteristic bulges of a guitar.
The going and returning of a plough, or other implement used to mark the ground and create a headland, across a field.
To contest a bout.
In a circle around; all round; on every side of; on the outside of.
definitions.example: The snake was coiled about his ankle.

definitions.definition: Over or upon different parts of; through or over in various directions; here and there in; to and fro in; throughout.
definitions.example: He was well known about town.

definitions.definition: Indicates that something will happen very soon; indicates a plan or intention to do something.
Concerning; with regard to; on account of; on the subject of; to affect.
definitions.example: He talked a lot about his childhood.

definitions.definition: Concerned with; engaged in; intent on.
definitions.example: to be about one's business

definitions.definition: Within or in the immediate neighborhood of; in contiguity or proximity to; near, as to place.
definitions.example: I can't find my reading glasses, but they must be somewhere about the house.

definitions.definition: On one's person; nearby the person.
definitions.example: I had no weapon about me but a stick.

definitions.definition: In or near, as in mental faculties or in the possession of; under the control of; at one's command; in one's makeup.
definitions.example: He has his wits about him.

definitions.definition: The act of putting someone into danger, or the condition of being in danger.
The exposure of someone, especially a child, to danger or harm.
